meanings.definition: Eroses (verb): to erode or wear away
meanings.sent1: The constant rain slowly eroses the rocks along the riverbank.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the wind eroses the sand dunes in the desert.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy accidentally eroses the sandcastle while digging.
meanings.sent4: The old photographs erose away, fading into distant memories.
meanings.sent5: The waves relentlessly erose the cliffs, shaping the coastline.

meanings.definition: Eroses (noun): plural form of eros, the Greek god of love and desire
meanings.sent1: In Greek mythology, Eroses were known as the companions of the god Eros.
meanings.sent2: The statues in the temple depicted the Eroses dancing around the god of love.
meanings.sent3: During the festival, people dressed up as Eroses to celebrate love and desire.
meanings.sent4: The painting captured the essence of the Eroses, symbolizing passion and affection.
meanings.sent5: Legends say that the Eroses spread love and desire wherever they went.
